question.questionText: Under what circumstances will a switch affect a bulb?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: When the switch and the bulb are contained in the same path

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: If the bulb and the switch are contained in the same path, then the switch affects the bulb.
when there is a closed path
a bulb is contained in the closed path
the switch will affect the bulb if it is on the path with the bulb to the battery
if a bulb is in a closed path with a battery and a switch, the switch will affect the bulb.
if a switch is open and the path is not closed, the bulb will be off. if the switch is closed and the path is closed, the bulb will be on.
when the switch is in the same path as the bulb
a switch will effect a bulb if it is in the same path as the battery
if the switch is open, the bulb will be off. if the switch is closed the bulb will be on.
When a switch is on the same path as the battery and the bulb
